docs.lead_paragraph: Hillary Clinton saluted Rosa Parks in Montgomery, Ala., on the 60th anniversary of Mrs. Parks’s refusal to give up her seat on a public bus.
docs.snippet: Hillary Clinton saluted Rosa Parks in Montgomery, Ala., on the 60th anniversary of Mrs. Parks’s refusal to give up her seat on a public bus....

headline.main: Clinton Pays Tribute to Rosa Parks

docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton, speaking at an event commemorating Rosa Parks, said there was something “profoundly wrong” with how black men are treated by the system.
docs.snippet: Mrs. Clinton, speaking at an event commemorating Rosa Parks, said there was something “profoundly wrong” with how black men are treated by the system....
docs.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton, speaking at church in Montgomery, Ala,  on 60th anniversary of arrest of Rosa Parks,calls for overhauling nation's criminal justice system; says it is 'profoundly wrong' when black men are disproportionately subjected to stops, searches and arrests by police.

headline.print_headline: Clinton, on Anniversary of Rosa Parks Arrest, Calls for Justice System Overhaul
headline.main: Hillary Clinton Calls for Overhaul of Justice System

docs.lead_paragraph: The university rebutted Exxon’s accusation that articles about the oil company, produced by journalists from the school, were misleading and inaccurate.
docs.snippet: The university rebutted Exxon’s accusation that articles about the oil company, produced by journalists from the school, were misleading and inaccurate....
docs.abstract: Columbia Graduate School of Journalism Dean Steve Coll publicly disputes allegations by Exxon Mobil that two investigative articles published in Los Angeles Times, written by journalists from school, were inaccurate and deliberately misleading about disparity between company's public position on climate change and its internal knowledge of issue; dispute highlights possibility that, on both sides of public policy debates, manner in which expensive accountability reporting is funded can create perceptions of bias.

headline.print_headline: Columbia Disputes Exxon on Climate Risk Articles
headline.main: Columbia Disputes Exxon Mobil on Climate Risk Articles

docs.lead_paragraph: Presidential candidate Hillary Clinton pays tribute to Rosa Parks, saying she "either did something tremendous or something rather humble." Rough Cut (no reporter narration).

docs.lead_paragraph: Exxon Mobil Corp has hired a star attorney in an aggressive response to mounting scrutiny over the company's climate change disclosures, according to people familiar with the matter.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's a central question facing Ted Cruz's campaign as he gains momentum in the Republican presidential primary race: Can the uncompromising conservative unite a polarized nation and work with what he's derisively called Washington's "cartel" of career politicians, lobbyists and special interests?
docs.snippet: It's a central question facing Ted Cruz's campaign as he gains momentum in the Republican presidential primary race: Can the uncompromising conservative unite a polarized nation and work with what he's derisively called Washington's "cartel" of ca...

headline.print_headline: Voters Wonder if Cruz Can Heal Washington's Bitter Divisions
headline.main: Voters Wonder if Cruz Can Heal Washington's Bitter Divisions

docs.lead_paragraph: Top Republicans who worry that Mr. Trump’s increasingly plausible nomination could result in a sweeping electoral defeat also express a reluctance to take him on.
docs.snippet: Top Republicans who worry that Mr. Trump’s increasingly plausible nomination could result in a sweeping electoral defeat also express a reluctance to take him on....
docs.abstract: Number of leading Republican officials, strategists and donors express concern that Donald J Trump's nomination for president would lead to sound defeat and unravel gains GOP has made in recent congressional, state and local elections; strong disagreement has developed within party over whether to attempt to push Trump out of race and risk even more damaging public feud.

headline.print_headline: As Trump Barrels On, His Party Is Paralyzed
headline.main: Wary of Donald Trump, G.O.P. Leaders Are Caught in a Standoff

docs.lead_paragraph: Former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley appealed to House Democrats on Tuesday to keep him in their consideration as he runs for president.

docs.lead_paragraph: Standing in the pulpit where the Rev. Martin Luther King Jr. led the historic Montgomery bus boycott, Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton reached out to black voters Tuesday saying the U.S. is still plagued by injustices such as mass incarceration and attempts to roll back voting rights— and she urged Americans to rebuild their bonds with one another.

headline.print_headline: Clinton Commemorates Boycott, Says US Must Address Injustice
headline.main: Clinton Commemorates Boycott, Says US Must Address Injustice

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. military is better prepared now for an attack in Africa than it was when a U.S. diplomatic facility in Benghazi, Libya, came under a deadly siege in 2012, a member of the House Benghazi committee said Tuesday.
docs.snippet: The U.S. military is better prepared now for an attack in Africa than it was when a U.S. diplomatic facility in Benghazi, Libya, came under a deadly siege in 2012, a member of the House Benghazi committee said Tuesday....
